message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of secure transmission of messages, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The presence of an eavesdropper and the need for perfect secrecy suggest that the paper may also belong to the sub-category of cryptography (cs.CR). The use of side information and the study of minimum key lengths suggest that the paper may be related to coding theory (cs.CC) and data structures (cs.DS). Finally, the problem of index coding may also be relevant to the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI).
